Articles.Content: whoops...not sure if you guys have noticed this, but your runway marking should be "90" instead of "09" as they are always marked facing their heading.  "27" coming from the other side is correct though!

It looks correct to me.  Look again.

In the U.S. we drop the '0' and paint just '9' on the runway for magnetic heading 90°,
but we would never write '90'.
Runways only go from 01 to 36. Although not every runway is at a exact 10 degree angle, a runway at 122 degrees heading would be RWY 12.

A runway number is determined by the first two digits of it's heading.

Case in point: London heathrow:

https://skyvector.com/airport/EGLL/London-Heathrow-Airport

4 runways, 09L and 09R (90 degrees) and 27L and 27R (270 degrees)
I believe that would be from 090. Three digit code where the last one is cut
